clusters.title: UK clinical trial into puberty blockers on hold after medicines regulator steps in
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Clinical Trial Into Puberty Blockers On Hold

items.title: UK clinical trial into puberty blockers on hold after medicines regulator steps in
items.standfirst: Recruitment of children for study delayed after MHRA warns that participants should be no younger than 14 A clinical trial into puberty blockers for children has been paused after the medicines regulator warned it should have a minimum age limit of 14 because of the “unquantified risk” of “long-term biological harms”.Discussions between the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) and the trial sponsor, King’s College London, will begin next week to discuss the wellbeing concerns, the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) said on Friday evening. Continue reading...
items.content: Recruitment of children for study delayed after MHRA warns that participants should be no younger than 14 A clinical trial into puberty blockers for children has been paused after the medicines regulator warned it should have a minimum age limit of 14 because of the “unquantified risk” of “long-term biological harms”.Discussions between the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) and the trial sponsor, King’s College London, will begin next week to discuss the wellbeing concerns, the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) said on Friday evening. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Clinical trial into puberty blockers for children has been paused
The trial was paused due to concerns over long-term biological harms
The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency warned of risks
Recruitment of children for the study has been delayed
Discussions will take place to address the wellbeing concerns

clusters.title: Having a stoma bag isn’t usually so bad as it’s been for Tracey Emin | Letters
clusters.neutral_headline: Having A Stoma Bag Isn’t Usually So Bad As It’s Been For Tracey Emin

items.title: Having a stoma bag isn’t usually so bad as it’s been for Tracey Emin | Letters
items.standfirst: Readers reflect on their experiences of urostomy after reading our interview with Tracey EminIn your interview with Tracey Emin about A Second Life, her forthcoming major exhibition at Tate Modern, and other matters (‘Regrets? Number one: smoking. Number two: taking it up the wrong hole’: Tracey Emin on reputation, radical honesty – and Reform, 14 February), she comments on the difficulties in her life now that she is living without a bladder.While data is patchy, about 100 people a week undergo this surgery in the UK, commonly known as a urostomy. For all those people waiting to have this surgery it is a traumatic time, and I think it’s important to point out that this often life-saving surgery usually has much a much better outcome than Tracey has had. Continue reading...
items.content: Readers reflect on their experiences of urostomy after reading our interview with Tracey EminIn your interview with Tracey Emin about A Second Life, her forthcoming major exhibition at Tate Modern, and other matters (‘Regrets? Number one: smoking. Number two: taking it up the wrong hole’: Tracey Emin on reputation, radical honesty – and Reform, 14 February), she comments on the difficulties in her life now that she is living without a bladder.While data is patchy, about 100 people a week undergo this surgery in the UK, commonly known as a urostomy. For all those people waiting to have this surgery it is a traumatic time, and I think it’s important to point out that this often life-saving surgery usually has much a much better outcome than Tracey has had. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Tracey Emin discusses her experiences with a urostomy
About 100 people a week undergo urostomy surgery in the UK
The surgery is often life-saving but can have traumatic outcomes
Many people have reported better outcomes than Tracey Emin
The experiences of urostomy patients can vary greatly

clusters.title: ‘Very dangerous’: a Mind mental health expert on Google’s AI Overviews
clusters.neutral_headline: ‘Very Dangerous’: A Mind Mental Health Expert On Google’s AI Overviews

items.title: ‘Very dangerous’: a Mind mental health expert on Google’s AI Overviews
items.standfirst: Information content manager Rosie Weatherley says harmful inaccuracies are presented as uncontroversial factsMind launches inquiry into AI and mental health after Guardian investigationA year-long commission has been launched by Mind to examine AI and mental health after a Guardian investigation exposed how Google’s AI Overviews, which are shown to 2 billion people each month, gave people “very dangerous” mental health advice.Here, Rosie Weatherley, information content manager at the largest mental health charity in England and Wales, describes the risks posed to people by the AI-generated summaries, which appear above search results on the world’s most visited website. Continue reading...
items.content: Information content manager Rosie Weatherley says harmful inaccuracies are presented as uncontroversial factsMind launches inquiry into AI and mental health after Guardian investigationA year-long commission has been launched by Mind to examine AI and mental health after a Guardian investigation exposed how Google’s AI Overviews, which are shown to 2 billion people each month, gave people “very dangerous” mental health advice.Here, Rosie Weatherley, information content manager at the largest mental health charity in England and Wales, describes the risks posed to people by the AI-generated summaries, which appear above search results on the world’s most visited website. Continue reading...

items.title: Mind launches inquiry into AI and mental health after Guardian investigation
items.standfirst: Exclusive: England and Wales charity to examine safeguards after Guardian exposed ‘very dangerous’ advice on Google AI Overviews‘Very dangerous’: a Mind mental health expert on Google’s AI summariesMind is launching a significant inquiry into artificial intelligence and mental health after a Guardian investigation exposed how Google’s AI Overviews gave people “very dangerous” medical advice.In a year-long commission, the mental health charity, which operates in England and Wales, will examine the risks and safeguards required as AI increasingly influences the lives of millions of people affected by mental health issues worldwide. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: England and Wales charity to examine safeguards after Guardian exposed ‘very dangerous’ advice on Google AI Overviews‘Very dangerous’: a Mind mental health expert on Google’s AI summariesMind is launching a significant inquiry into artificial intelligence and mental health after a Guardian investigation exposed how Google’s AI Overviews gave people “very dangerous” medical advice.In a year-long commission, the mental health charity, which operates in England and Wales, will examine the risks and safeguards required as AI increasingly influences the lives of millions of people affected by mental health issues worldwide. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Google's AI Overviews have been criticized for mental health advice
Mind mental health expert Rosie Weatherley warns of inaccuracies
The AI-generated summaries can present harmful information
Mind is launching an inquiry into AI and mental health
The inquiry will examine the risks and safeguards required
